verses.verse: Maschil of Asaph. O God <S%H430><s%>, why hast thou cast us off <S%H2186><s%> for ever <S%H5331><s%>? Why doth thine anger <S%H639><s%> smoke <S%H6225><s%> against the sheep <S%H6629><s%> of thy pasture <S%H4830><s%>?

Remember <S%H2142><s%> thy congregation <S%H5712><s%>, which thou hast gotten <S%H7069><s%> of old <S%H6924><s%>, Which <S%H7626><s%> thou hast redeemed <S%H1350><s%> to be the tribe of thine inheritance <S%H5159><s%>; And mount <S%H2022><s%> Zion <S%H6726><s%>, wherein thou hast dwelt <S%H7931><s%>.
Lift up <S%H7311><s%> thy feet <S%H6471><s%> unto the perpetual <S%H5331><s%> ruins <S%H4876><s%>, All the evil <S%H7489><s%> that the enemy <S%H341><s%> hath done in the sanctuary <S%H6944><s%>.
Thine adversaries <S%H6887><s%> have roared <S%H7580><s%> in the midst <S%H7130><s%> of thine assembly <S%H4150><s%>; They have set up <S%H7760><s%> their ensigns <S%H226><s%> for signs <S%H226><s%>.
They seemed <S%H3045><s%> as men that lifted up <S%H935><s%> Axes <S%H7134><s%> upon a thicket <S%H5442><s%> of trees <S%H6086><s%>.
And now <S%H3162><s%> all the carved work <S%H6603><s%> thereof They break down <S%H1986><s%> with hatchet <S%H3781><s%> and hammers <S%H3597><s%>.

They have set <S%H7971><s%> thy sanctuary <S%H4720><s%> on fire <S%H784><s%>; They have profaned <S%H2490><s%> the dwelling-place <S%H4908><s%> of thy name <S%H8034><s%> by casting it to the ground <S%H776><s%>.

They said <S%H559><s%> in their heart <S%H3820><s%>, Let us make havoc <S%H3238><s%> of them altogether <S%H3162><s%>: They have burned up <S%H8313><s%> all the synagogues <S%H4150><s%> of God <S%H410><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%>.
We see <S%H7200><s%> not our signs <S%H226><s%>: There is no more any prophet <S%H5030><s%>; Neither is there among us any that knoweth <S%H3045><s%> how long <S%H5704><s%>.
How long <S%H430><s%>, O God, shall the adversary <S%H6862><s%> reproach <S%H2778><s%>? Shall the enemy <S%H341><s%> blaspheme <S%H5006><s%> thy name <S%H8034><s%> for ever <S%H5331><s%>?
Why drawest <S%H7725><s%> thou back thy hand <S%H3027><s%>, even thy right hand <S%H3027><s%>? Pluck <S%H3615><s%> it out of <S%H7130><s%> thy bosom and consume them <S%H2436><s%>.
Yet God <S%H430><s%> is my King <S%H4428><s%> of old <S%H6924><s%>, Working <S%H6466><s%> salvation <S%H3444><s%> in the midst <S%H7130><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>.
Thou didst divide <S%H6565><s%> the sea <S%H3220><s%> by thy strength <S%H5797><s%>: Thou brakest <S%H7665><s%> the heads <S%H7218><s%> of the sea-monsters <S%H8577><s%> in the waters <S%H4325><s%>.

Thou brakest <S%H7533><s%> the heads <S%H7218><s%> of leviathan <S%H3882><s%> in pieces <S%H5414><s%>; Thou gavest him to be food <S%H3978><s%> to the people <S%H5971><s%> inhabiting the wilderness <S%H6728><s%>.
Thou didst cleave <S%H1234><s%> fountain <S%H4599><s%> and flood <S%H5158><s%>: Thou driedst up <S%H3001><s%> mighty <S%H386><s%> rivers <S%H5104><s%>.
The day <S%H3117><s%> is thine <S%H3915><s%>, the night also is thine <S%H3559><s%>: Thou hast prepared the light <S%H3974><s%> and the sun <S%H8121><s%>.
Thou hast set <S%H5324><s%> all the borders <S%H1367><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>: Thou hast made <S%H3335><s%> summer <S%H7019><s%> and winter <S%H2779><s%>.

Remember <S%H2142><s%> this <S%H341><s%>, that the enemy hath reproached <S%H2778><s%>, O Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, And that a foolish <S%H5036><s%> people <S%H5971><s%> hath blasphemed <S%H5006><s%> thy name <S%H8034><s%>.

Oh deliver <S%H5414><s%> not the soul <S%H5315><s%> of thy turtle-dove <S%H8449><s%> unto the wild beast <S%H2416><s%>: Forget <S%H7911><s%> not the life <S%H2416><s%> of thy poor <S%H6041><s%> for ever <S%H5331><s%>.

Have respect <S%H5027><s%> unto the covenant <S%H1285><s%>; For the dark <S%H4285><s%> places of the earth <S%H776><s%> are full <S%H4390><s%> of the habitations <S%H4999><s%> of violence <S%H2555><s%>.
Oh let not the oppressed <S%H1790><s%> return <S%H7725><s%> ashamed <S%H3637><s%>: Let the poor <S%H6041><s%> and needy <S%H34><s%> praise <S%H1984><s%> thy name <S%H8034><s%>.

Arise <S%H6965><s%>, O God <S%H430><s%>, plead <S%H7378><s%> thine own cause <S%H7379><s%>: Remember <S%H2142><s%> how the foolish man <S%H5036><s%> reproacheth <S%H2781><s%> thee all the day <S%H3117><s%>.

Forget <S%H7911><s%> not the voice <S%H6963><s%> of thine adversaries <S%H6887><s%>: The tumult <S%H7588><s%> of those that rise up <S%H6965><s%> against thee ascendeth <S%H5927><s%> continually <S%H8548><s%>.
